comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Is "Old Time" like God's time we heard about a while back, meaning none of that Government Daylight Savings nonsense?

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content:
Is there some relationship to this Hickey?

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland/5908238452/sizes/l/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 30622421@N03
comment._content: It is rather timeless - we had a store in Belfast that I was taken into often in the early sixties and even the clothing on display looked like this! It had money tubes.

comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/vab2009] There's an old time department store in central Reading that hasn't changed much from those days. Still has the pneumatic money tube system working. www.jacksonsofreading.co.uk/about.htm www.dooyoo.co.uk/department-stores/jacksons/179983/

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyelightfilms] Pneumatic Tube Transport Systems are still manufactured by Quirepace Lamson, formerly Lamson Paragon. I remember the wooden ball Cash Carrier system in Co-op shops in the 1950s. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cash_Carrier

comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] Oh yes, indeed. My local Tesco, (in England), uses a pneumatic tube system running from each cash register to a central office. Both it and that Jackson's shop in Reading were featured in a BBC radio doc about pneumatic tubes a few years ago.

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: Ladies Wear, Mrs. Slocombe must be on her break.... :)

comment.author: 30622421@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyelightfilms] How great that it is still un-"plasticised"!
